customer_name: CENTER FOR CONS & RESEARCH OF ENDANGERED WIL
site_name: CENTER FOR REPRODUCTION OF ENDANGERD WILDLIFE

citations.narrative:
Enclosures are not protecting animals from injury. Exposed electrical cords are in two enclosures that are each housing
one adult cat. The cats have access to the electrical cords and could be injured as they could chew on the cord, ingest the
cord, or become entangled. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they protect the cats from
injury. Correct by ensuring that the enclosures protect the animals from injury. Correct by 23-AUG-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives.
n
